author: A_Brickset_user
title: JUST OK
review:
Nice starter set, but what do they think at lego???
Do we really need 90 squares !!! I would have prefered a lot more beams.
2 cars (yellow and blue)
1 door (yellow with red door)
1 window (red with yellow window)
4 squares rounded of(2 red,2 blue)
1 snale (green double 8 block)
1 sun (blue double 8 block)
2 square eyes (yellow 4 block)
1 itsy bitsy spider (double 2 block)
2 sloped pieces (yellow)
1 double square( yellow)
90 squares (four colours)
32 bricks (size 8, four colours)
1 beam (size 12, blue)
1 beam (size 16, red)

author: BrickBuiltBill
title: Great starter box
review: This set was a STAPLE of my early, early childhood; the version I had was the 2002 release, under the Explore branding. If you're a parent of a 1 1/2 -5 year old, and if you find this at a secondhand store (or on eBay), DEFINITELY pick it up. At the risk of sounding redundant, I have to say that I had a lot of fun with this set. If it has a good price, by all means pick it up.
